posts.post_content:
the design of the artwork is fantastic - you can see every existing atog card older than this one displayed there. *(from left bottom corner to right upper corner: [Chronatog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chronatog), [Atog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Atog), [Auratog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auratog), [Necratog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necratog), [Foratog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Foratog))*.  
especially the name is genious, and the stats are also suiting perfectly to this card!  
yet it's such a pity he doesn't have trample. a guy like this should actually be a finisher.  
maybe they didn't give him this ability as there wasn't any other atog that gained more than increased p/t.  
[Megatog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megatog) broke this consistancy anyways some years later...
